titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the John E. Seley Ground Zero Photographs [digital]
2001
PR 347
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Joseph Ditta

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-28T11:04-0500

did.unittitle: John E. Seley Ground Zero photographs [digital]
did.abstract: Seventy-seven digital images documenting the destruction of the World Trade Center at Ground Zero in the two months following the terrorist attack of September 11, 2001. The photographer, John E. Seley, is a professor of Urban Planning and Geography at The City University of New York Graduate Center.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to reproduce any Print Room holdings through publication must be obtained from: Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 270. Fax: (212) 579-8794.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: According to John E. Seley (in an Email message dated September 2, 2011), he assembled a CD of pictures taken by himself and several firefighters in the two months following the terrorist attack of September 11, 2001. Some photos were shot inside the office of Seeley's father-in-law on the 21st floor of the World Financial Center, "an office made famous in a picture of a beam sticking out of the building." Seeley wrote that he had "not seen any other pictures of that office from inside."

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Archivist Joseph Ditta processed this collection in November 2017.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of John E. Seley, October 2011.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection (one CD and a 13-page paper printout of thumbnails) is housed in a single folder.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: John E. Seley, PhD (University of Pennsylvania), is a professor of Urban Planning and Geography at The City University of New York Graduate Center. His wife is New York State Senator Liz Kreuger.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as the John E. Seley Ground Zero Photographs [Digital], PR 347, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Credit line (for exhibition labels): John E. Seley.

controlaccess.subject: September 11 Terrorist Attacks, 2001 -- Pictorial works
World Trade Center (New York, N.Y.) -- Pictorial works

did.unittitle: Seventy-seven digital photographs [one CD + 13-page paper printout of thumbnails] of Ground Zero taken between September 12 and circa November 12, 2001
